title: French MP proposes bill to protect children's privacy on social media
description: The tendency to post images of one's children on social media has a name: sharenting. For Bruno Studer, a Renaissance MP, this phenomenon is one of the main risks of infringement of the privacy of minors.

title: Greek train crash stationmaster charged and jailed
description: The 59-year-old stationmaster allegedly directed the two trains traveling in opposite directions onto the same track.

title: Solar geoengineering: Madness or last resort against global warming?
description: Climate manipulation techniques trigger interest but also concerns due to a lack of knowledge regarding the consequences of its use and the absence of supervision.

title: Xi Jinping seeks to further consolidate his power at China's annual parliament session
description: Outgoing premier Li Keqiang painted a bleak picture of the global outlook, against the backdrop of China's increasing military spending.

title: Soft power, spying, extensive data collection... What is TikTok accused of?
description: Several governments have issued bans on the popular app among teenagers, fearing that it could be used by China to spy on its users.

title: Kate and William at the Six Nations Championship: It may be a detail to you
description: But not to 'Le Monde' journalist Marc Beaugé. The Princess of Wales and her husband went to Cardiff on Saturday, February 25 to support their respective teams during the Six Nations Championship. Namely England for her, and Wales for him.

title: The mental burden carried by children of immigrants: 'When I was 8, my mother told me I needed to know how to write checks'
description: Their parents do not speak French, so they become interpreters, doing the taxes or translating what the doctor says. A premature responsibility for these children.

title: Egypt sentences 14, including rights activists, on terrorism charges in trial
description: Rights groups have decried the arrest of the 14 and said their trial reflected “gross violations of their right to a fair trial.”

title: Prince Harry and Meghan invited to King Charles' coronation
description: The California-based couple, who quit the British monarchy in 2020 amid increasing tensions, are yet to decide whether to attend.

title: Greek PM seeks forgiveness over rail tragedy as thousands protest in Athens
description: Kyriakos Mitsotakis sought forgiveness from victims' families in a message posted on his Facebook page Sunday, March 5, as protesters rallied and clashed with police in Athens.

title: 'The tech industry is missing a major talent pool: Women'
description: In an op-ed, Corinne Dajon and Henri d'Agrain, members of Femmes@Numérique, and Emmanuelle Larroque, from the Social Builder NGO, argue for a multi-year skills-building policy.

title: In Copenhagen, Noma is closing while Geranium is growing
description: While René Redzepi's mythical Noma has announced its closure for 2024, Geranium has taken the title of world's best restaurant in the 50 Best ranking. A revolution in the Danish culinary scene, which continues to dictate gastronomy trends.

title: Berlin's missile defense shield project angers Paris
description: On February 15, Sweden and Denmark joined 15 other European countries in the European Sky Shield, an integrated short, medium and long-range defense program launched by Germany in October 2022.

title: A year after Oscars slap, Chris Rock hits back in new Netflix special
description: After being smacked by Will Smith during last year's Oscars ceremony, the comedian gave his rebuttal in his first stand-up special since the incident, streamed live on Netflix.

title: UN States reach historic agreement on first international treaty to protect high seas
description: After more than 15 years of discussions, including four years of formal talks, the third so-called final negotiating session in less than a year heralded the long-awaited consensus.

title: Railway workers announce strike beginning March 7 despite government concessions
description: Despite the €100 billion promised by Elisabeth Borne, alternative pension plans and the future role given to the Société du Grand Paris has not reassured railway workers.

title: China annouces low GDP growth target of 'around 5 percent' and increase in military spending
description: During its annual National People's Congress in Beijing, China’s government announced plans for a consumer-led revival of the struggling economy and an increase in its military spending of 7.2% while warning of 'escalating' threats from abroad.

title: PSG defender Achraf Hakimi indicted for rape but 'supported' by his club
description: The 24-year-old Moroccan international has been accused by a woman of the same age, who claims to have been assaulted on February 25 at the player's home. The sportsman's lawyer believes that her client is the subject of 'attempted extortion.'

title: Russian policy of deporting Ukrainian children under investigation by ICC
description: Karim Khan, the prosecutor of the International Criminal Court, visited sites in southern Ukraine as part of his investigation into the deportation of Ukrainian children to Russia.

title: Formula 1: In 2023, Alpine imagines itself as a podium contender
description: With its French driver duo of Esteban Ocon and Pierre Gasly, and its fourth place win in 2022, the French team begins the F1 season on Sunday at the Bahrain Grand Prix.

title: Estonians to vote in the shadow of Russia
description: The legislative elections are to be held on Sunday, at a time when the country is deeply affected by the war in Ukraine.
